description: Come Stand Up Paddleboarding (SUP) on the beautiful Toronto Islands just minutes from the Toronto downtown core. Toronto Island SUP is a business dedicated to connecting people with the outdoors and the water by offering quality SUP experiences. It's easy to escape the 'hustle & bustle' of the city by taking a short ferry ride to Wards Island to enjoy the beauty it has to offer. We operate every day of the week. Book on our website and receive special instructions for meeting and what to bring.

reviews.title: So much fun!
text: So much fun! Our instructor was very helpful and thorough and we all had a great time learning paddle board and enjoying the Island's natural beauty!

reviews.title: Great experience
text: My family and I (husband, kids ages 12, 17, 20) had a great time. Staff were so friendly and accommodating. Julian was a fantastic guide. Beautiful scenery to look at while learning basics of paddle boarding. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: "Enjoying the Park's Tranquility in May"
text: We had a great time there, even though most activities and places were closed in May and don't start until June. The best part was enjoying the park itself with fewer crowds!

reviews.title: Highly recommended!
text: The eco tour was really great. It was our first time on the SUP, but that was no problem. The tour was very chill, with lot of attention for the environment: the presence of birds, fish, history of the islands, etc. Very nice views of the Toronto skyline! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Great tour with James!
text: It was great to find out more about the islands of toronto. We went on 2 tandem kayaks and it was a great experience with James, our guide. It was also nice because you could hear the rumble and hum of the indycar engines.

reviews.title: Fascinating
text: It was amazing to see wildlife like Great Blue Herons just a few minutes paddling from Lake Ontario and the Island Airport. The Islands are a gem and this is a great way to see a lesser known part of them. And it was a fun easy intro to SUP as well.

reviews.title: Fun times in a kayak!
text: We signed up for a kayak lesson. The team was quite accommodating when we asked for the sit on top kayaks and were able to accommodate that! The lesson with Julian is incredible as he is an amazing instructor! We learned several paddle strokes and paddles around some of the quiet areas on Toronto Island! If you are thinking of using this business, just go ahead and do it! Hands down they are awesome!!!

reviews.title: Love it
text: Itâ€™s a wonderful experience! Watching the whole Toronto city view from the middle of lake is incredible. Una was coaching us. She is a wonderful coach. We learned how to do Sup in several minutes. She also introduced fun stuff about the lake. Love Her. Love this experience.

reviews.title: Eco tour
text: Wonderful Eco tour, with knowledgeable guides, in a wonderful, friendly and magical atmosphere. Thank you!

reviews.title: Awesome way to spend a summer evening!
text: Everything about the Sunset Safari was perfect. The route the guides take you on gives you multiple photo ops and a gorgeous view of the city skyline! The guides are really friendly and make you feel super comfortable and confident on the water.
Could not recommend the Sunset Safari more!

reviews.title: Day trip adventure!
text: I have long wanted to try SUP, but there isn't anywhere to do it near where I live, so when we started planning a day trip to Toronto, I googled and found Toronto Island SUP. I booked a lesson via their website, received confirmation and reminder emails and was able to print the waiver, good communication and ease of use overall. Our lesson was in the lagoon on Wards Island, to which you'll have to take the ferry or water taxi from Toronto. We took the ferry, and bought tickets prior to arriving which was good because the line at the Jack Layton ferry terminal was insane! Be sure to give yourself plenty of time to get there. We arrived early so we grabbed a bite to eat at the Rectory Cafe, which was right across the path from the Algonquin Bridge where we were to meet for the lesson. The "location" was a utility vehicle with trailer that was used to bring all the gear to the bridge meeting site. Once it was time for the lesson we turned in our waivers, put on a life vest, grabbed a paddle and circled up for some basic introductory info, then into the water we went. Julian was a good instructor, I felt comfortable from start to finish. We started out on our knees until we were comfortable, then stood when we were ready. We toured the lagoon, then went out toward the lake and that iconic Toronto skyline, which was a great spot for a photo. We were out for about an hour, it was a blast! This is definitely and experience that I'll remember for a long time!

reviews.title: Awful customer service
text: Pre-booked an introductory course and whole experience was disappointing. They dont  have any lockers or lock boxes to put your stuff in while you are doing your lesson. Obviously you have belongings because you plan on spending the day on the island. Its a leave by the tent at your own risk or use one of their dry bags at your own risk.

We showed up at 255pm for our 330pm lesson so yes we were early but they ignored us and wouldnt take our waivers or suit us up until the instructor got there, fine. Instructor showed up at 315 still not taking waivers or suiting us up until the rest of the class got there. The four other people that were part of our group didnt show up until 4pm. Even though there are clear instructions on the web that if you are not on time you forfeit your lesson with no refund they still made us wait. The staff helped these people first while we still stood waiting.

Once we finally got ready to go out our instructor was so soft spoken we could barely hear her over the hustle and bustle of the beach and boats on the water. SUP was a lot of fun but i would NOT do it here again. Better off doing it in cottage country where they appreciate people more.

reviews.title: Fun way to see islands!
text: Our family of four rented SUPs for an hour and paddled around Ward Island. Beautiful view of the city. Great alternative to touring without the crowds and very relaxing.

reviews.title: Great Adventure!
text: We went on the Eco tour this past weekend. We were all SUP novices and not only was our instructor patient, but was a great teacher. He took us on a beautiful route where we saw turtles and were surrounded by beautiful nature. Hard to believe we were still in Toronto. We'll definitely return!!

reviews.title: Great experience, worth trying
text: We originally came here because my partner didn't get a chance to try stand up paddle boarding in Vancouver. We did the intro course, where we were instructes by Julian and a newer instructor who ran us through the basics from how to use the paddle, to putting he board in the water, then eventually how to stand without falling in. The location was calm and quiet, and made learning alot easier than having alot of city noise and onlookers. Honestly was a great experience, and worth trying at least once. Cheers Julian for the mentoring and confidence trip!

reviews.title: Introduction to SUP
text: My first intro to SUP happen to be on a September morning weekend with lots of rain and 13 Celsius degrees. Julian, my private guide helped me out and in 30 min I was on my own stand up and paddling with full confidence. I am telling you: it is way much more fun than canoeing or kayaking, Try it on Toronto lagoons, nothing can beat this!

reviews.title: Great intro lesson and a whole lot of fun!
text: My wife had been thinking of trying paddle boarding for the past 2 years.  Months ago she told me not to buy her a paddle board in the event she tried it and didn't like it.  I decided to surprise her with SUP lessons as part of her birthday gift.   I checked Tripadvisor and other company's websites and liked that Toronto Island SUP has you "travel" to the lovely Toronto Islands and if you so desired, can make a day of it on the islands.  Also I liked that their introduction lesson was described on their informative website as 75 minutes long which included free time on the board at the end of your lesson.  Most if not all other companies offered 60 minute lessons.

I checked their website thoroughly and found all the information there to plan my time with them.  I bought my ferry tickets online for the first time and I highly recommend that, especially during the warmer busier months.  I wasn't sure if online tickets would get me through the gate earlier so we still left our home extra early just in case.  Although there was a HUGE line at the ferry docks on the land side, we were able to walk right through and not line up as we had online tickets. As a result, we ended up being one and a half hours early.  No issue because it's so nice to walk around Toronto Islands.

We arrived at the south beach of Ward's island 15 minutes before our scheduled time as recommended.  By the way, instructions including directions are on their website and on the tickets once you place your order.  Julian was our instructor and our class was full which is capped at 6 people.  Nice small size for great instruction and supervision by the instructor.  Although I could not feel any wind, the waters were a bit choppy.  More so than 1.5 hours earlier when were first saw the waters on our arrival.  I am 50 years old and in average shape with not great cardio.  And my swimming capabilities are below average.  Julian instructed us on how to properly adjust the length of your paddle and other basic instructions while on the beach.  Then we headed out onto the water where he constantly provided instructions and supervision while giving us time to practice his new instruction.  Even though there was a lot of swimmers in the water, we paddled out around the swimmers to where the boats were anchored in the lake.  The water was clear once you got away from the shore area.  So clear that you could see the bottom of the lake in the areas you paddle(not too deep).  I found the most trouble balancing on the board (wobbled a lot compared to everyone else in the group) and fell in the water 3 times.  The last two times was when I momentarily looked elsewhere.  By the way, the humidex was 40 degrees Celsius at this time and the water was very warm.  I couldn't believe how great the water felt.  At the end of the instructions, Julian gave us 15 minutes on the water to do what we pleased.  In addition to the instructor, Toronto Police lifeguards are on rowboats in the water also keeping an eye on you.  Do not bring valuables with you if you don't need them as they are not responsible for lost or stolen items.  No one had anything lost or stolen but I am just mentioning this as no one should bring anything that is not necessary whenever you will not have them with you irregardless of the activity.  The most important thing, my wife and I had a fantastic time and talked about it all the way home.  We will be returning as our children heard what fun we had and they want to do it now.  Thanks Julian!

reviews.title: Fantastic experience!
text: My girlfriends and I went to TISUP last weekend and had an incredible time. I never realized how beautiful Lake Ontario was until I was out on a SUP board. We booked several hours which was a great amount of time to tucker ourselves out exploring the island and the lake. Thank you TISUP for a truly unique Toronto experience!

reviews.title: Awesome
text: Friendly staff, amazing location, good prices! Satisfied!
Make sure the weather is good. the rest you will get there:)

reviews.title: Toronto Island SUP team was very helpful!
text: My partner and I rented a SUP board for 1 hour and we had arrived a bit late, but the TISUP team was very accomodating and helpful. They made sure to give us a few pointers and tips before we headed out into the water even though we didn't sign up for a lesson. I enjoyed my experience with TISUP and would rent a paddleboard from them again.

reviews.title: Great weekend activity
text: The Toronto islands are an amazing place to go SUPing, and the Algonquin bridge rental location was ideal. The water is calm and easy to paddle, the scenery is beautiful with a great view of the Toronto skyline, and there are lots of spots to pull over and take pictures.
The reservation process was easy, and the staff onsite were friendly and helpful.
We went at 10:30am and then had the rest of the day to explore the islands. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Excellent Eco SUP tour Toronto Island
text: I thoroughly enjoyed this SUP tour with a friend and her 11 year old grandson.   We loved Julian and his fabulous energy.  He was excellent with his overview instruction of paddling SUP for the newcomers and also with his knowledge of the Toronto Islands.   I highly recommend this 2.6km paddle.   We slowly wound our way through the eco restored areas where we saw turtles, blue heron, and various birds.   Views of the city skyline were spectacular!
I will definitely go back and explore more of the Islands.
Pam

reviews.title: Great area for beginners
text: I rented a board alone with very little experience and it was great. Friendly staff and good explanation

reviews.title: What a delightful way to experience this city!
text: I booked this trip for a relative who was visiting from another country because I thought it would be a fun, active way to see the city - spot on! The best part is that you don't feel like you're in the biggest city in Canada, you feel like you are in cottage country.
We loved our tour guide as well (James). He was so pleasant and friendly, and told interesting stories. He really read the group to make sure everyone was happy.
You do NOT need to be an athlete to do this adventure, so don't let that stop you from doing this tour!

reviews.title: Priceless Memories Made
text: On May 27, my husband, my 9 year old son, and myself drove to Toronto and took the ferry to Ward Island. There our SUP Eco Tour began. James, our tour guide, was awesome! He was very patient and knew so much about the island. We saw 10 turtles and some other cool wildlife, and had an amazing day on the water. Ward Island is such a gem just a quick ferry ride from the busy city. Loved every minuteðŸ’œ

reviews.title: Fantastic SUP Eco Tour!
text: My sister and I took our father on the SUP eco tour for his birthday, and it was a great experience! We had all done a bit of paddle boarding before, so this was more interesting that your standard lesson. Our guide did give us a bit of a refresher, which was much appreciated

We got to see parts of the Toronto Islands most visitors don't know about and saw some really cool wildlife. Our guide was really knowledgable and taught us all about the different flora and fauna on the island.
Would definitely recommend doing this. (And I would also recommend wearing adequate sun protection if you're fair skinned like me! Not a lot of shade on this two-hour tour.)

reviews.title: Fantastic morning, beautiful scenery!!
text: We booked on the 10.30am eco tour - we were the only ones booked on the tour and our guide was fantastic. No experience of paddle boarding needed, as we were given a quick tutorial of how to stand and turn etc, and then we paddled round the beautiful islands! Fish and birds and small mammals were pointed out to us as we paddled. The islands and beautiful and very peaceful.
Would highly recommend as an escape from the busy city!

reviews.title: Great experience
text: I had a great experience with Toronto Island SUP in June 2016. The views of the Toronto skyline are unreal. The pictures were so incredible that they are now my FB profile pic! They are extremely friendly and were very patient with us as we had constant delays and ended up arriving later than planned. They squeezed us in and provided us all with boards and friendly service. They even took a picture of us from the bridge. Paddling through the little waterways was amazing - we kept forgetting we were just across from a concrete jungle.

reviews.title: Fun, fun, fun
text: O you already windsurf? Great! If you don't, no worries. The instructors will teach you all the basics, and you'll probably be standing on your board within 20 minutes, having the time of your life.
Bring nothing but your gear ... This is a no-frills operation, no lockers, nothing. I just brought ID ... Left my clothes and ID by the "shop".
Had a whole lot of fun, even though I was too chicken to stand up on that paddleboard. Next time, for sure!

reviews.title: Great family activity if you have teens and little ones
text: We had an amazing experience. We have eight year between the youngest and oldest child which can make it hard to find an activity that meets the needs of everyone.
We bought our ferry ticket online ahead of time which saves time. We booked for 10:15 and took the 9:30 ferry which was perfect as the islands get so busy as the day goes on.
My son and his friend, ages 14 and 12,  were able to paddle board while I played on the beach with the younger girls.  Although I understand that only on the weekends do they operate on the beach.
The instructioner gave a quick yet excellent  lesson as our friend had never been before.
We needed to rebook as our car broke down the first weekend we set out but they were able to make the changes with ease and concern.
We will be back.

reviews.title: Adventure in nature with a city skyline in sight
text: Great nature excurtion -simply incredible contrasts between untamed natural reserves on the islands and the Toronto skyline- Great guide- taught us effortlessly all we needed to manoeuvre the SUP - great fun and lots learned and retained by all - highly recommended

reviews.title: A great experience
text: A great outing.  In addition to eco experience we also learned some new paddle boarding techniques, which really helped.  We saw mink and king fishers, which used to be illustrated on the Canadian $5 bill.  Would definitely recommend.  And a big thanks to our guide for giving Rowan an impromptu one wheel experience.

reviews.title: Great SUP experience
text: We had a great experience touring around the Toronto Islands on a stand-up paddle boat this summer. Our guide, James Statham, was great. Not only did he teach us the basics but he also gave us some pro-tips.
Getting to know Toronto Island on a SUP is unique an exceptional experience. I highly recommend it.

reviews.title: good paddleboarding site
text: Excellent instructions and Easy access to boards!  Strict forward to the place, numerous boards and classes to choose!

reviews.title: Loved it!
text: We had an awesome time touring around the Toronto islands on the SUPs. Definitely recommend reserving for 2 hrs - anything less and youâ€™ll not do the experience justice. The booking was super easy, we were able to change our reso online without issue when our sitter bailed and the service at the dock was great.
It does take a bit of detective work to find them once you get on Wardâ€™s Island. My only reco is that they have some signage with an arrow pointing you in the right direction

reviews.title: Eco tour is a beautiful experience, but we expected more info on the animals for the price
text: The guy taught us how to paddle and a couple of more advanced moves. The landscape was beautiful and the pace was adapted to the group. He explained us a couple of interesting facts, like the origin of the islands and some facts on the animals. However, if you already have paddled for quite some time, there are many things you already know or have seen. So, overall good and beautiful, but we expected more for the price. For example, more specialized information on the animals or their habitats, etc.

reviews.title: Eco Sup Tour
text: We attended a session to do an ECO paddle with a focus on bird watching during the migration season; it was interesting.  Lots of birds, information, etc.  We stayed within the channels of the island not the open lake.

SUP is a great way to reset and refresh.  Anyone looking to escape the city, local or tourist, should consider a day on the island.    If you're experienced at SUP, rent a board, grab a map, take a couple hours and enjoy at your leisure.  If not, head out with the group.  You'll be in good hands.
BTW, I also had to cancel and reschedule.  It was easy and worked just as stated on the website.  No issues, easy peasy.
Enjoy the paddle!

reviews.title: Amazing
text: I wasenÂ´t in the best time of the year but if you like to walk you can see Toronto from different views. Visit the place before November and it is very cold, You should wear clothe warm and enjoy the place.

reviews.title: What an amazing adventure
text: Awesome experience.  Grant gave us a very well informed intro to paddle boarding and then we had the time of our lives.  I highly recommend SUP for anyone of any level.  You will not be disappointed.  I plan on going back next weekend :)

reviews.title: SUP rental on the island
text: It was easy and convenient to book a rental on-line. They do a quick test to see if you can paddle in kneeling and standing. Then you are free to explore the lagoons and islands in the area. It is a fun way to bird watch and explore the smaller islands that are more easily accessible. A nice island activity.
